page.title: 08Law and Order in Parbold
page.content: { } Four of the pupils (St. Richard's High School, Skelmersdale) had an interview with a Police Constable, based in nearby Skelmersdale, to ask him about crime in the Parbold area. He said that Parbold was a generally quiet and peaceful village and there was not a great deal of crime. The worst offence he could recall was a murder committed 8 years ago, and a man reported that on Christmas Eve 1984 all his turkeys, chickens,pigs,cheese and pork had been stolen. There were worrying signs, however, that there is an increase in the number of houses broken into - to about 10 per year. He did add that as the village had grown, they were finding that they were losing the personal touch, and that people did not know each other as well.
